entry.et: Middle English professioun, from Anglo-French profession, from Late Latin & Latin; Late Latin profession-, professio, from Latin, public declaration, from profitēri

def.dt: :the act of taking the vows of a religious community
:an act of openly declaring or publicly claiming a belief, faith, or opinion :protestation
:a calling requiring specialized knowledge and often long and intensive academic preparation
:the whole body of persons engaged in a calling
